name: UIScene
desc: An object that represents one instance of your app’s user interface.

items.name: init(session: UISceneSession, connectionOptions: UIScene.ConnectionOptions)
items.desc: Creates a scene object using the specified session and connection information.

items.name: var delegate: UISceneDelegate?
items.desc: The object you use to receive life-cycle events associated with the scene.

items.name: protocol UISceneDelegate
items.desc: The core methods you use to respond to life-cycle events occurring within a scene.

items.name: var activationState: UIScene.ActivationState
items.desc: The current execution state of the scene.

items.name: enum UIScene.ActivationState
items.desc: Constants that indicate the foreground or background execution state of your app.

items.name: var title: String!
items.desc: A user-visible string you supply to help users differentiate among your app’s scenes.

items.name: var subtitle: String
items.desc: A string that the app displays in the title bar of a window when running in macOS.

items.name: var activationConditions: UISceneActivationConditions
items.desc: The conditions that define when UIKit activates the scene object.

items.name: class UISceneActivationConditions
items.desc: The set of conditions that define when UIKit activates the current scene.

items.name: class let willConnectNotification: NSNotification.Name
items.desc: A notification that indicates that UIKit added a scene to your app.

items.name: class let didDisconnectNotification: NSNotification.Name
items.desc: A notification that indicates that UIKit removed a scene from your app.

items.name: class let willEnterForegroundNotification: NSNotification.Name
items.desc: A notification that indicates that a scene is about to begin running in the foreground and become visible to the user.

items.name: class let didActivateNotification: NSNotification.Name
items.desc: A notification that indicates that the scene is now onscreen and responding to user events.

items.name: class let willDeactivateNotification: NSNotification.Name
items.desc: A notification that indicates that the scene is about to resign the active state and stop responding to user events.

items.name: class let didEnterBackgroundNotification: NSNotification.Name
items.desc: A notification that indicates that the scene is running in the background and is no longer onscreen.

items.name: var session: UISceneSession
items.desc: The session associated with the scene.

items.name: class UISceneSession
items.desc: An object that contains information about one of your app's scenes.

items.name: func open(URL, options: UIScene.OpenExternalURLOptions?, completionHandler: ((Bool) -> Void)?)
items.desc: Attempts to open the resource at the specified URL asynchronously.

items.name: class UIScene.OpenExternalURLOptions
items.desc: Options you specify when asking a scene to open a URL.

items.name: var pointerLockState: UIPointerLockState?
items.desc: The pointer lock state for the scene.

items.name: class UIPointerLockState
items.desc: An object that contains information about a scene’s pointer lock state.

items.name: class UIScene.ActivationRequestOptions
items.desc: An object that contains information you want the system to use when activating the session associated with a scene.

items.name: class UISceneDestructionRequestOptions
items.desc: An object you pass to UIKit to permanently remove a scene and its associated session from your app.

items.name: class UIScene.OpenURLOptions
items.desc: Options that UIKit provides when asking your app to open a URL.
